cab.content: B 0 RETWAR CABINET COPYWAR OFFICE,WHITEHALL, S.W.22nd March,1917Secretary,War Cabinet.Herewith ten copies of a telegram No.878, dated 21st instant, from General Hanbury-Williams, in connection with the Russian situation, for circulation to the War Cabinet please.(Sgd.) F.MAURICE D.M.O.SECRETOperations.From:- General Hambury-Williams. To:- C.I.G.S. Repeated Ambassador.21/3/17878.This morning Emperor assembled his staff to say good-bye, wishing all success to Army. General Staff informs me that, all oyer the country, very strong feeling is growing, in favour of appointment of Grand Duke Nicholas as C. in G.Telegrams coming in, though not yet published, from all districts. This is naturally good sign, and having served personally with him for first 12 months of war and invariably been shown greatest kindness by him, I hope it will prove correct.
